meanings.definition: A traditional Russian dance involving high kicks and squatting movements.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, the performers showcased their energetic kazatskies.
meanings.sent2: The group of dancers practiced their kazatskies routine for weeks.
meanings.sent3: At the talent show, the kazatskies dancers brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The kazatskies performance was a whirlwind of colorful costumes and lively music.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the kazatskies dance lingered in the minds of the spectators.

meanings.definition: Plural form of kazatsky, a type of dance.
meanings.sent1: The stage was filled with talented dancers performing kazatskies.
meanings.sent2: Audiences cheered as the group of friends danced kazatskies together.
meanings.sent3: The kazatskies in the show were a delightful mix of skill and joy.
meanings.sent4: The room echoed with the sound of kazatskies echoing through the hall.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the kazatskies was evident in every graceful movement.

meanings.definition: To perform kazatskies, a type of dance.
meanings.sent1: She loves to kazatskies with her dance group on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The dancers will kazatskies at the cultural festival next month.
meanings.sent3: He kazatskies in the park to entertain passersby with his talent.
meanings.sent4: The children kazatskies happily in the school talent show.
meanings.sent5: They decided to kazatskies together to celebrate their friendship.
